baseline_groups.claim_summary: Sophisticated (low expense ratio) investors withdrew significantly more from money market funds during the September 2008 crisis week.
baseline_groups.notes: Table 3 Column 3. Cross-sectional OLS of cumulative log flows (Sept 12-19, 2008) on fraction of fund assets in institutional share classes with ER<=35bp. A one-unit increase in sophisticated investor fraction is associated with 35.8pp more outflow.

global_notes: Single baseline group. The paper has one primary claim: sophisticated investors (proxied by low expense ratio share classes) ran harder during the crisis. Specifications 044, 045, 069-070 use fund/complex FE with expense ratio as within-fund treatment, which is an alternative identification strategy testing the same underlying claim. Specifications 075-079 are auxiliary (Table 1 first-stage, Table 4 dynamics) supporting identification rather than the main result. spec_025 (incl_retail) produces identical coefficients to spec_001 because the sample restriction ER<=35bp already excludes retail classes.
